Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Vase
Description: Small round vase with flattened base, short neck and small lip. The vase is wheel-made from a buff-coloured clay with traces of an organic temper and has traces of red colouring on the outside. The lip, with an verage thickness of 0,2 cm, is partly chipped. The body is 5,5 cm wide.
